Chemical Actions and Uses/Pharmacologic Actions/Molecular Mechanisms of Pharmacological Action/Membrane Transport Modulators/Calcium Channel Agonists
Record.Description: Agents that increase calcium influx into calcium channels of excitable tissues. This causes vasoconstriction in VASCULAR SMOOTH MUSCLE and/or CARDIAC MUSCLE cells as well as stimulation of insulin release from pancreatic islets. Therefore, tissue-selective calcium agonists have the potential to combat cardiac failure and endocrinological disorders. They have been used primarily in experimental studies in cell and tissue culture.
